Name: Lores Beyond the Ranges
Description: Two mysterious events happened in Hongzhen. Xinyi presumes there are ulterior motives behind them...
QuestDesc: Two mysterious events happened in Hongzhen. Xinyi presumes there are ulterior motives behind them...

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: —Rover, it's been some time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have a request to make... Hongzhen is in danger. I need your assistance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's discuss in person. The coordinates have been sent to your Terminal. I'll wait for you there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's been some time, Rover.

Options.PlotLineKey: It feels like forever. How are things going in Hongzhen?

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There is still much to be done, but things are finally looking up for Hongzhen. We've weathered the storm, and the darkest times are behind us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sentinel's barrier is gone, and Mt. Firmament can be seen once more. Now, Hongzhen and other parts of Huanglong are reconnected.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At such a pivotal moment, it is even more essential to document our recent events in detail for future generations.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To that end, the Magistrate and I have gathered a team of scholars from Jinzhou to revise the Hongzhen Chronicle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A scholar named Qianyue is cataloging recent tales around Hongzhen.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: However, she mentioned certain... strange phenomena in her reports.

Options.PlotLineKey: This world is stranger than any supersition.
I bet there's more to the story.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Indeed. I agree with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's surely someone or something with wicked intentions at play here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I fear some exploit this chaos to spread discord. A thorough investigation will expose these troublemakers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, I ask for your help. Assist Qianyue in uncovering the truth so peace may be restored to our town!

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hunter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes? You are…? Oh, I see. You folks are here for the snow monster too?

Dialogues.Speaker: Hunter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Imagine a tank-sized ape, with the power to freeze everything around it into ice sculptures.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hunter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I saw it once as a kid, just a glimpse of its back while tagging along with my dad in the mountains.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Sounds like a Tacet Discord with freezing abilities.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, how do you intend to find the snow monster this time?

Dialogues.Speaker: Hunter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This time? I never actually encountered it. If I had, I wouldn't have lived to tell the tale!

Dialogues.Speaker: Hunter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But, I did come across… evidence of its hunting.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Evidence of its hunting?

Dialogues.Speaker: Hunter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay, long story short.  I went hunting in the mountains and found some strange contraptions at the base of Loong’s Ridge.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hunter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I thought they were left by the Court of Savantae. No idea what they were for. You know, I haven't found anything related to the Court of Savantae there before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hunter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe they have a secret vault nearby?

Dialogues.Speaker: Hunter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's what I thought. So I followed the contraptions trying to find it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did you find it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Hunter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course not. This is a tale about running into a snow monster,  not about a thief hitting the jackpot with a vault!

Dialogues.Speaker: Hunter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I trekked up the mountain and saw some... animals. Oh, not just any animals, there were Tacet Discords too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tacet Discords? They didn't attack you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Hunter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nope. When I found them, they were all frozen solid.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hunter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Birds, deer, even the Tacet Discords—every one of them frozen stiff. You could see every hair crystal clear.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hunter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Can you believe it? Even the snowflakes around them were frozen. Gave me the creeps, I tell you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So you think the snow monster did all this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Hunter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who else would it be? What else could turn living creatures into those… terrifying ice sculptures?

Dialogues.Speaker: Hunter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I totally forgot about the vault and ran like the wind, terrified that the snow monster would jump out from nowhere and turn me into a popsicle like the rest of them.

Options.PlotLineKey: The snow monster and the Court of Savantae…

Dialogues.Speaker: Hunter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, why didn't I think of it sooner... The Court of Savantae must've sealed that monster with one of their contraptions, and someone let it out by mistake!

Dialogues.Speaker: Hunter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That explains everything! No wonder it's been centuries since the last time people saw the snow monster…

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hold up, didn't you say you saw it as a kid?

Dialogues.Speaker: Hunter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did I? Ha… Hahaha, well, yes, besides ME, it's been centuries since anyone saw the snow monster!

Dialogues.Speaker: Hunter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uh, wait! And my father! He saw it too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Qianyue doesn't ask more questions, but the skeptical look on her face suffices to show her opinion.

Options.PlotLineKey: Ahem, well, thank you for your help.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hunter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By the way, if you're planning to hunt the snow monster, why not grab some of my poison arrows? They're made to take down wild beasts quickly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hunter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Think about it. You'll be out there, staring down that snow monster, wishing you had something to defend yourself with. Trust me, you'll regret not taking these.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hunter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Smart move. Here. It took me years to craft these beauties.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But… they look just like regular arrows?

Dialogues.Speaker: Hunter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, open your eyes! These are no ordinary arrows. The tips are poisoned. The one I used is colorless, odorless, safe for humans, but deadly to beasts!

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …Well, maybe keep them to yourself for now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hunter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fine, your call. Just don’t say I didn’t warn you when the time comes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hunter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, you're not the only ones curious about that snow monster. Excuse me, got another customer… adventurer to attend to.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The hunter leaves in a hurry, taking his deadly, invisible, and odorless poison arrows with him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, I've got all that recorded. I'll sort through it later.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't help but feel… these two incidents aren't quite what I had pictured.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The herb collector didn't even get a clear look. From his description, sounds more like a rare Tacet Discord than a monster.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But the whimpering or howling he mentioned does pique my interest. If it was a Tacet Discord or a monster… why didn't it attack him?

Options.PlotLineKey: It might be friendly to humans.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That makes sense. Maybe a Tacet Discord got stuck in a trap or wedged in a crevice?

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That makes sense. I've heard some Tacet Discords are friendly towards humans.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm, now that could be the real story behind this "evil ghost."

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for the hunter, he gave a really detailed account.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If he were making it up, he wouldn't have included verifiable details like the creations of the Court of Savantae.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Which means the frozen animals are real. The Court of Savantae creations are real, but…

Options.PlotLineKey: The snow monster might be a lie.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's right! No snow monster, just a ruse to sell those poison arrows.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He did see the frozen animals, but he didn't know who did it and how.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Spreading rumors about the snow monster was just a way to lure in hunters.

Options.PlotLineKey: Now, there's only one question left.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, who froze those animals? Tacet Discords? Doesn't quite add up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Something's off about these two sightings. Maybe we need to visit the locations for answers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello? Excuse me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Herb Gatherer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes…? You are…

Dialogues.Speaker: Herb Gatherer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Story…? It's not a story! It really happened to me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Herb Gatherer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was almost killed on that mountain! Just the thought of it sends shivers down my spine, like it's still lurking out there, watching...

Dialogues.Speaker: Herb Gatherer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look behind me, you don't see anything, do ya?

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No…?

Dialogues.Speaker: Herb Gatherer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's a relief. With so many people in Hongzhen, I bet that thing wouldn't dare show its face. But that place… I wouldn't set foot there again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do you mean by that place? Where is it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Herb Gatherer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Curiosity killed the cat, they say. Getting mixed up with that monster will only spell disaster. I must've lost my mind insisting on checking it out…

Options.PlotLineKey: We're gathering tales for the Hongzhen Chronicle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Herb Gatherer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Madam Xinyi…? So, she heard the rumor too? Not surprising, she always takes everything here seriously.

Dialogues.Speaker: Herb Gatherer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Gathering tales…? I've heard those pages are filled with countless regional folktales, so it’s only natural you’d want to add this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Herb Gatherer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, if you're here to listen, I'll tell you exactly what happened.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hold on! Let me start the recording first… Alright, please go on.

Dialogues.Speaker: Herb Gatherer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It all began three days ago. I was deep in the mountains hunting for a rare herb and lost track of time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Herb Gatherer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By the time I stumbled upon the herb, night had fallen. Fearful of beasts prowling after dark, I decided to take a shortcut back to Hongzhen.

Dialogues.Speaker: Herb Gatherer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When I reached Loong's Crest, I heard some... strange noises coming from the darkness. They sounded like metal clashing and scraping, mixed with eerie cries.

Dialogues.Speaker: Herb Gatherer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I thought it was just a poor Scarefrost Deer caught in a trap, so I pressed on. But the deeper I went, the creepier it got.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What kind of noises?

Dialogues.Speaker: Herb Gatherer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hard to describe. Whimpers? Howls? Whatever it was, it wasn't human, and it sure as hell wasn't any beast I'd ever crossed paths with.

Dialogues.Speaker: Herb Gatherer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: More like a twisted combination of both.

Dialogues.Speaker: Herb Gatherer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The noises gave me goosebumps. Then I remembered the story my grandmother once told me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Herb Gatherer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Long ago, the Sentinel and the Court of Savantae worked together, using their bizzare creations to seal some real vicious monsters.

Dialogues.Speaker: Herb Gatherer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Their bodies crumbled to dust over the years, but their evil souls hung around, craving revenge on the Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Revenge on the Sentinel? That's wild!

Dialogues.Speaker: Herb Gatherer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahem, I'm talking here, young lady. Interrupt again and I won't say another word.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, I'm so sorry…

Dialogues.Speaker: Herb Gatherer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Where was I? Ah, yes, the evil souls. I was in a dilemma, you know. Terrified as I was, curiosity gnawed at me, urging me forward…

Dialogues.Speaker: Herb Gatherer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Suddenly, out of nowhere, two lanterns appeared in front of me. It happened so fast, I didn't even realize it was impossible to have lanterns out in the wilderness like that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Herb Gatherer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The lanterns seemed to float, barely visible. They flickered once, then a few seconds later, flickered again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Herb Gatherer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It wasn't until then that I realized they weren't lanterns at all, but eyes! Eyes as big as lanterns. How big would its head be?

Dialogues.Speaker: Herb Gatherer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I turned and ran, and that monster kept howling behind me. Believe me, I've never heard anything so bone-chilling.

Dialogues.Speaker: Herb Gatherer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I didn't dare look back, just ran for my life. I lost track of time, but eventually, I saw the lights of Hongzhen and knew I was safe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I heard you passed out at Hongzhen's entrance, right? Thank goodness the night patrol found you. Otherwise…

Dialogues.Speaker: Herb Gatherer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Non-nonsense! I didn't pass out! Just… a bit tired from the running! Yeah, I was tired!

Dialogues.Speaker: Herb Gatherer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, whatever was chasing me must be the souls of those monsters! One wrong step, and I'd have been its next meal!

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, that's all been recorded. What's your take, Rover?

Options.PlotLineKey: I doubt it's some evil ghost.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, I agree. I've heard nerves can make you see things that aren't real. Maybe it was just a Scarefrost Deer... or a passing Tacet Discord?

Dialogues.Speaker: Herb Gatherer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you're really curious, go see the monster for yourself. I spotted it near Loong's Crest. Just remember, I did warn you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: H-here we are... This should be the location mentioned by the herb collector.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's investigate the surroundings. Look, I've got a camera. I'll make sure to take pictures of anything unusual!

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's this doing here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's a memo attached to it, but it seems to be stained with ink.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, someone was experimenting on animals and Tacet Discords here…?

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But something went wrong, so they had to bail.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What are these boxes for?

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like they were used to store equipment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This cage must be for the really big one.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But it looks brand new. I don't think it's been used.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fantastic! I think we captured everything noteworthy around here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, could you scan the area again? I want to make sure we haven't missed anything.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that… a claw mark?

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's long and deep… What could've left this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's gotta be a big one. Seen any beasts around here that could've done this?
Hey, you two! This stuff is ours! Hands off!

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's… it's the Fractsidus!

Dialogues.Speaker: Hubris Artificer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Didn't you hear me? Drop it! Leave now and maybe I'll spare you. Otherwise…

Dialogues.Speaker: Ogo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Have you lost your mind? It's that Rover! Even Mr. Scar is no match for {Male=him;Female=her}!

Dialogues.Speaker: Hubris Artificer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover…? So what?

Dialogues.Speaker: Hubris Artificer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We endured so much, paid such a high price… No, with this new power nothing will stand in our way!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ogo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our mission isn't to cause a scene! We're here to assess the camp's condition. We should try talking, not wrecking everything in sight—

Dialogues.Speaker: Hubris Artificer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This opportunity is being handed to us! With our numbers, we can easily deal with them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hubris Artificer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't you want to prove your worth? Then join me against the Fractsidus's enemies!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ogo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I-I don't want to do crazy stuff like this!

Dialogues.Speaker: Hubris Artificer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, get back here, you idiot!

Dialogues.Speaker: Hubris Artificer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Coward! I'll definitely report him to the boss.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hubris Artificer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No biggie, we still have the upper hand. Let's go. Take them down!

Options.PlotLineKey: Find a place to hide, Qianyue.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: O-okay. Take care, Rover!

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That was… AWESOME! Like, bam, pow, and they were down!

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Me? I'm totally fine. They didn't get within a mile of me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Scared? Why? They're no Tacet Discord, and not even close to a real monster.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Fractsidus caused Jinzhou and Hongzhen so much misery. Honestly, seeing them get beaten up... Oops, I mean punished, is kinda satisfying, not gonna lie.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jinzhou's been my home since I can remember.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These guys have robbed and killed. If I were a Midnight Ranger or even a Patroller, I'd have taught them a lesson!

Options.PlotLineKey: It's not as easy as you think.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Together, we stand strong! Even an ordinary person like me, with the right tools, can fight! Can defend MY home!

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmph, I should've joined the Midnight Rangers instead of the Imperial Academy. Spending all day writing dull editorials... Too late now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, almost forgot our mission. We've got all the clues, so the truth must be…

Options.PlotLineKey: The Fractsidus was doing experiments here.
The herb collector saw a beast.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Right! The Fractsidus caught some animals and Tacet Discords… all for some kind of experiment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They must've stumbled on that big one, the same one the herb collector saw. Luckily it must be harmless, so the collector got lucky.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Fractsidus set a trap but ended up provoking it. They had to bail when it fought back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I wonder if that "snow monster" was their doing too?

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Fractsidus… items left by the Court of Savantae… frozen animals… experiments using Tacet Discords...

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's gotta be a link, but what?

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, let's go to Loong's Ridge first. Maybe we'll find answers there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We made it! I don't think I walked this much all of last year...

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look! Items left by the Court of Savantae. This should be the place. Rover, let's search around.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, this must be the Fractsidus's experiment log.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If what's written here is true, it's awful…

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These devices look like what those Court of Savantae guys make. Their designs clearly aren't based on modern Automata Mechanics.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're called "Photonvaults." They're able to halt time within a certain range.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So you mean those animals were… Yeah, that should be it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've arrived, Rover, it's right over there!

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hold on. It looks like…

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't bother going over. It's too late…

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've arrived, Rover, it's right over there!

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hold on. It looks like…

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't bother going over. It's too late…

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What did the Fractsidus do…? He was one of their own…

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Take cover somewhere safe. I'll handle this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is it… is it over? Is Ogo…

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see… That's okay. We did… we did everything we could.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I read his diary. All he wanted to do was survive, but… he's not as lucky as we are.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He didn't have a safe place to call home or the means to protect himself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I used to think justice was everywhere in Huanglong, just like in Jinzhou.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We have the Midnight Rangers guarding us and the Patrollers keeping order. Everyone lives in peace.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To me, Tacet Discords and Tacet Fields were just distant stories, less real than the monsters in fairytales.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But today, I realized that… they're right here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha… I’m not blaming myself. I just feel… like I’ve been slacking off all this time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …No, I did nothing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm still the little girl who once looked at the Midnight Rangers believing they could solve every single problem…

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I never thought about who needed help, let alone took action. Looking back, I feel ashamed…

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But first, I gotta figure out what my heart wants.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, I have all the details recorded. When I get back to Hongzhen, I'll write them in the Chronicle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Next up... I might just join the Pioneer Association and travel the world. I want to see what lies beyond Jinzhou's walls with my own eyes.

Options.PlotLineKey: Taking that first step is key.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're right. I've got to take that first step.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, Rover. Let's head back to Hongzhen.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your efforts seem to have borne fruit. What conclusions have you drawn about the incidents, Rover?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You tell Xinyi about what happened.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, it was the Fractsidus behind these disturbances, all to push their disgraceful goal. How despicable.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for bringing this vital information to light. I shall ensure that patrols around Mt. Firmament are intensified to prevent any further attempts by these miscreants.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh yes, and Qianyue seems to have found her footing since she returned.

Options.PlotLineKey: This journey did make her grow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There is no better teacher than experience itself. I hold high hopes for her future contributions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once again, Rover, I'm grateful for your assistance in this matter.

Dialogues.Speaker: Focused Resident
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...And then that monster popped up right in front of my friend! Its eyes were as big as lanterns, and its teeth as long as rolling pins!

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, interesting... Please, continue.

Dialogues.Speaker: Focused Resident
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My friend knew enough not to turn his back on the monster—he'd be an easy meal!

Dialogues.Speaker: Focused Resident
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So he backed away slowly and stepped on a rock. He bent down and used everything he had to pick it up and... guess what?

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He drove the monster away with the rock?

Dialogues.Speaker: Focused Resident
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, the monster just vanished into thin air! Not even a footprint in the snow!

Dialogues.Speaker: Focused Resident
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm telling you, it's no ordinary monster! It's a ghost, the vengeful spirit of a slain beast...

Options.PlotLineKey: Don't you have a better story?

Dialogues.Speaker: Focused Resident
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You don't believe me, do you? I'm not making this up! My friend told me himself!

Dialogues.Speaker: Focused Resident
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah? If not, where could this story have come from? My friend who got eaten?

Dialogues.Speaker: Focused Resident
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fine, believe what you want. My throat's parched from all this yapping. I'm off to grab a cup of tea.

Dialogues.Speaker: Focused Resident
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, by the way, he lives just around the corner. Go ask him yourself if you think I'm pulling your leg.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With that, the resident shrugs and strolls off.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, it's good to have a witness at least.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, that's me. And you must be the Rover, the hero Madam Xinyi spoke of from Jinzhou and Hongzhen?

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't be modest. Your heroic deeds are already recorded in the Hongzhen Chronicle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm just a newbie intern, so I don't get to write those epic tales... yet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But that's fine, I have my own mission. I'm investigating the two Mt. Firmament incidents. Once I piece it all together, it'll go into the Hongzhen Chronicle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, one is the sighting of a huge monster, as the gentleman mentioned.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The other comes from a hunter who found animals and Tacet Discords frozen solid in a valley.

Options.PlotLineKey: Sounds like someone is up to something.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Indeed. I've read through the Hongzhen Chronicle, and it says the Sentinel's barrier keeps out Tacet Discords, even Elite Class ones.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The rare Elite Class Tacet Discords are only spotted in far-off places. In the Chronicle, they're dubbed "beasts," "scourges," or even "blessings."

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, probably because Elite Class Tacet Discords are super rare, they're almost mythical, seen as omens of good or bad luck.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, based on these witness accounts, I think there's a link between this monster and the "beast" in the Chronicle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rumors have been flying around, getting all exaggerated, but I’m still unclear on where these incidents actually happened.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But here's the kicker—I've tracked down the rumor spreaders.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yep, one's a herb collector from Hongzhen, and the other's a hunter. Makes sense, given their line of work.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But…

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, I do think Tacet Discords are behind all this, but still I can't help but wonder... do ghosts really exist?

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I-I suspected as much. I've studied Remnant Ecoacoustics, so I know it's just a natural phenomenon caused by Reverberations!

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For real? Have you seen a ghost before, Rover?

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Y-yeah, just a natural phenomenon. Nothing to be scared of!

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is excitement, not fear! Exploring the unknown is my jam!

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's go, Rover! It's time to uncover the truth!

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are those… cages? Who would put cages out here?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seems like they were used to lock something up. Good news is, it wasn't a person, judging from these claw marks.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's take some pictures, just in case.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh my… this is... gosh...

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is… a pretty steep hill…

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you alright? Do you want to take a break?

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm beat. Never hiked anything like this... Guess I'm not cut out for the Midnight Rangers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's okay. We're almost there. I can hang on a bit longer...

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh my… this is... gosh...

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is… a pretty steep hill…

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's okay. We're almost there. I can hang on a bit longer...

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A data tablet?

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like it's just a diary. I guess a Fractsidus member accidentally left it behind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They must've left in a hurry, leaving personal items behind like that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The box… It's empty.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Must be used to store a certain device. Whatever was inside, the Fractsidus must have taken.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qianyue
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But they left all their supplies at Loong's Crest. Hmm… maybe whatever was inside is important to them?
